snippet: Ismail Khan, a former mujahedeen commander, is calling on his followers to reorganize and defend the country as Western militaries withdraw.
abstract: Ismail Khan, one of Afghanistan's most powerful warlords, is calling on his followers to reorganize and defend country as Western forces withdraw; it is public demonstration of faltering confidence in national government and its army; statement rankles Afghan officials and stokes fears that other regional leaders will also rearm, weakening support for government and increasing likelihood of civil war.

byline.contributor: Habib Zahori and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Herat, Afghanistan, and an employee of The New York Times from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: Ismail Khan, a former mujahedeen commander, is calling on his followers to reorganize and defend the country as Western militaries withdraw.

headline.seo: Afghan Warlord Ismail Khan’s Call to Arms Rattles Kabul
headline.main: Afghan Warlord’s Call to Arms Rattles Officials
headline.print_headline: Afghan Warlord’s Call to Arms Rattles Officials
